answerText: acetal[10] Acetals are examples of these compounds, which are characterized by an oxygen single bonded to two carbons, a relationship symbolized R-O-R'(r-o-r prime).
heading: DRAGOON |2013 | 9 | 13 | Science | Chemistry | College
subject: Science
question: Question: Ethylene glycol is often used as a protecting group for aldehydes by converting them to one of these compounds. [10] Name these compounds that consist of a carbon single bonded to a hydrogen, another carbon, and two oxygen atoms.
